> Thanks a lot for help! Now the Heritrix works fine (I've added  
> PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule).  

No problem.

> As I understand, if I want to process not only html files (and also  
> jsp, php, etc.), I should set such regular expression:  
>   
> ^(?i)^.*\.(?:html?|?:jsp?|?:php?|doc|ppt)$ ,  

I would use
^(?i).*\.(?:html?|jsp|php|doc|ppt)$

'?:' is used to optimized regex if you don't need grouping/back- referencing

If you are not familiar with regex this is a good resource:
http://www.regular-expressions.info/

> 2) Is it possible to use seeds in old manner in this case (I mean  
> http://yahoo.com instead of http://yahoo.com/index.html)? 
> It's possible that I don't know beforehand the start page of the 
> site (index.html, index.php, or something else). 

Sure. Decide rules are pretty flexible. Maybe:

1) Add SeedAcceptDecideRule after the NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule rule.
2) Replace "reject NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule" rule, with reject 
MatchesFilePatternDecideRule. Just create regex of file extensions that 
you don't want to crawl.

There are probably more options. Please take a look at the decide rules.

Hope this helps.
i.
